revision.text:
{{Use American English|date=December 2018}} {{Use mdy dates|date=August 2018}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Antonee Robinson | image = Antonee Robinson USA v COL 2018 (45272402752) (cropped).jpg | fullname = Antonee Robinson{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/612828 |title=Updated squads for 2017/18 Premier League confirmed |publisher=Premier League |date=February 2, 2018 |accessdate=February 11, 2018}} | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1997|8|8}}{{cite web | title = Antonee Robinson | url = https://www.11v11.com/players/antonee-robinson-253799/ | publisher = 11v11 | accessdate = September 10, 2017}} | birth_place = [[Milton Keynes]], England | height = {{convert|1.83|m|order=flip}} | position = [[Left back]] | currentclub = [[Wigan Athletic F.C.|Wigan Athletic]] (on loan from [[Everton F.C.|Everton]]) | clubnumber = 3 | youthyears1 = 2008–2015 | youthclubs1 = [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] | years1 = 2015– | clubs1 = [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] | caps1 = 0 | goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2017–2018 | clubs2 = → [[Bolton Wanderers F.C.|Bolton Wanderers]] (loan) | caps2 = 30 | goals2 = 0 | years3 = 2018– | clubs3 = → [[Wigan Athletic F.C.|Wigan Athletic]] (loan) | caps3 = 15 | goals3 = 0 | nationalyears1 = 2014 | nationalteam1 = [[United States men's national under-18 soccer team|United States U18]] | nationalcaps1 = 1 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalyears2 = 2018– | nationalteam2 = [[United States men's national soccer team|United States]] | nationalcaps2 = 6 | nationalgoals2 = 0 | pcupdate = 14:55, November 10, 2018 (UTC) | ntupdate = October 16, 2018 }} '''Antonee Robinson''' (born August 8, 1997) is an American footballer currently playing for [[Wigan Athletic]] on loan from [[Premier League]] club [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] and the [[United States men's national soccer team|United States national team]] as a [[left back]]. ==Career== ===Everton=== Born in [[Milton Keynes]], England, Robinson came through Everton's [[Everton F.C. Reserves and Academy|academy]], having been with the academy since the age of 11.{{cite web|url=http://www.evertonfc.com/players/a/ar/antonee-robinson|title=Antonee Robinson|publisher=Everton Official Site|accessdate=August 10, 2017}} In June 2013, he signed a scholarships with the club, becoming a full-time player.{{cite web|url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2013/06/29/14-become-scholars|title=14 Become Scholars|publisher=Everton F.C.|date=June 29, 2013|accessdate=February 14, 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180112194918/http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2013/06/29/14-become-scholars|archivedate=February 14, 2018|deadurl=no}} While at the U18's side, however, Robinson suffered injuries that saw him sidelined most of the time and appeared for the U21 towards the end of the 2014–15 season.{{cite web|url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2015/05/26/thorniley-wins-top-prize-at-academy-awards|title=Thorniley Takes Top Academy Prize|publisher=Everton F.C.|date=May 26, 2015|accessdate=February 14, 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150920085615/http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2015/05/26/thorniley-wins-top-prize-at-academy-awards|archivedate=February 14, 2018|deadurl=no}} As a result, he was awarded the club's Under-18 Players' Player of the Season.{{cite web|url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2015/06/05/robinson-pleased-with-recognition|title=Robinson Pleased With Recognition|publisher=Everton F.C.|date=June 5, 2015|accessdate=February 14, 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180214203032/http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2015/06/05/robinson-pleased-with-recognition|archivedate=February 14, 2018|deadurl=no}} At the end of the 2014–15 season, he signed his first professional contract with the club after being offered a new contract.{{cite web|url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2015/06/10/club-submits-retained-list|title=Club Submits Retained List|publisher=Everton F.C.|date=June 10, 2015|accessdate=February 14, 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170825210345/http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2015/06/10/club-submits-retained-list|archivedate=February 14, 2018|deadurl=no}}
{{cite web|url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2015/07/03/grant-pens-new-deal|title=Grant Pens New Deal|publisher=Everton F.C.|date=July 3, 2015|accessdate=February 14, 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150924040604/http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2015/07/03/grant-pens-new-deal|archivedate=February 14, 2018|deadurl=no}} However, Robinson spent the most of the 2015–16 season sidelined on the cartilage under his kneecap, resulting in him having an operation.{{cite web|url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2016/05/29/next-generation-whos-next|title=Next Generation: Who's Next?|publisher=Everton F.C.|date=May 29, 2016|accessdate=February 14, 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170825212413/http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2016/05/29/next-generation-whos-next|archivedate=February 14, 2018|deadurl=no}} Despite this, he signed a one-year contract extension on July 15, 2016.{{cite web|url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2016/07/15/new-deals-for-charsley-and-robinson|title=Charsley & Robinson Extend Deals|publisher=Everton F.C.|date=July 15, 2016|accessdate=February 14, 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170825212604/http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2016/07/15/new-deals-for-charsley-and-robinson|archivedate=February 14, 2018|deadurl=no}} Robinson then played all three matches in the [[EFL Trophy]], which saw [[Everton F.C. Reserves and Academy|Everton U23s]] eliminated in the Group stage. He also became a regular for the U23 side.{{cite web|url=http://www.evertonfc.com/fixtures/2010-to-2019/2016-2017/football-league-trophy/cheltenham-town|title=Robinson Targets Trophy Progress|publisher=Everton F.C.|date=October 4, 2016|accessdate=February 14, 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180214212355/http://www.evertonfc.com/fixtures/2010-to-2019/2016-2017/football-league-trophy/cheltenham-town|archivedate=February 14, 2018|deadurl=no}} At the end of the 2016–17 season, Robinson signed a two-year contract extension with the club.{{cite web|url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2017/07/06/robinson-signs-contract-extension|title=New Deal For Young Blues Defender|publisher=Everton F.C.|date=July 6, 2017|accessdate=February 14, 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170709005741/http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2017/07/06/robinson-signs-contract-extension|archivedate=February 14, 2018|deadurl=no}} ===Bolton Wanderers (Loan)=== On August 4, 2017, it was announced that Antonee Robinson had signed on loan at [[Bolton Wanderers F.C.|Bolton Wanderers]] until January.{{cite web|url=https://www.bwfc.co.uk/news/2017/august/wanderers-sign-premier-league-starlet-on-loan/|title=Wanderers sign Antonee Robinson on loan|publisher=Bolton Wanderers F.C.|date=August 4, 2017|accessdate=February 14, 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170805060157/https://www.bwfc.co.uk/news/2017/august/wanderers-sign-premier-league-starlet-on-loan/|archivedate=February 14, 2018|deadurl=no}} Five days after joining the club, he made his debut in the [[EFL Cup|League Cup]] win at [[Crewe Alexandra F.C.|Crewe Alexandra]] on August 9, 2017, in a 2–1 win.{{cite news|title=Crewe Alexandra 1 – 2 Bolton Wanderers|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40798476|publisher=BBC Sport|date=August 9, 2017|accessdate=February 14, 2018}} Two weeks later, on August 22, 2017, he set up a goal for [[Jem Karacan]] to score the club's third goal of the game, in a 3–2 win over [[Sheffield Wednesday F.C.|Sheffield Wednesday]] in the League Cup.{{cite news|title=Bolton Wanderers 3 – 2 Sheffield Wednesday|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40932011|publisher=BBC Sport|date=August 22, 2017|accessdate=February 14, 2018}} It wasn't until on September 9, 2017 when he made his league debut for the side, starting the whole game, in a 3–0 loss against [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]].{{cite news|title=Bolton Wandrers 0 – 3 Middlesbrough|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41132802|publisher=BBC Sport|date=September 9, 2017|accessdate=February 14, 2018}} Robinson then established himself in the left-back position, beating off competition from [[Andrew Taylor (footballer, born 1986)|Andrew Taylor]].{{cite news|title=Dynamic Everton full-back Antonee Robinson can be out of this world for Bolton Wanderers, says Phil Parkinson|url=http://www.theboltonnews.co.uk/sport/15636276.Dynamic_Everton_loanee_Robinson_can_be_out_of_this_world/|publisher=The Bolton News|date=November 5, 2017|accessdate=February 14, 2018}} It was then announced on January 5, 2018 that Robinson had agreed to stay the remainder of the season at Bolton Wanderers.{{cite web|url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2018/01/05/robinson-bolton-loan-extended|title=Robinson's Bolton Loan Extended|publisher=Everton F.C.|date=January 5, 2018|accessdate=February 14, 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180108174846/http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2018/01/05/robinson-bolton-loan-extended|archivedate=February 14, 2018|deadurl=no}} Robinson then played a role in two separate matches; [[Sheffield United F.C.|Sheffield United]] and [[Bristol City F.C.|Bristol City]]; assisting the only goal in the game with a win, which saw them push the side out of the relegation zone.{{cite news|title=Sheffield United 0 – 1 Bolton Wanderers|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42463021|publisher=BBC Sport|date=December 30, 2017|accessdate=February 14, 2018}}
{{cite news|title=Bolton Wanderers 1 – 0 Bristol City|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42827859|publisher=BBC Sport|date=February 2, 2018|accessdate=February 14, 2018}} ===International career=== Robinson is eligible for both England and the USA, having been born in England to an American father from [[White Plains, New York]].{{cite web|url=http://americansoccernow.com/articles/antonee-robinson-making-most-of-loan-to-bolton|title=Antonee Robinson Making Most of Loan to Bolton|publisher=American Soccer Now|accessdate=November 26, 2017}} He has been capped at under-18 level with the USA,{{cite web|url=http://www.ussoccer.com/stories/2014/12/19/14/22/141219-u18mnt-falls-to-germany-in-spain|title=U.S. U-18 MNT FALLS TO GERMANY 3–2 IN MARBELLA, SPAIN|publisher=U.S. Soccer|accessdate=August 10, 2017}}{{cite web|url=https://lionofviennasuite.sbnation.com/2017/8/4/16095540/done-deal-bolton-wanderers-complete-loan-signing-of-everton-defender-usa-efl-epl|title=Done Deal: Bolton Wanderers complete loan signing of Everton defender|publisher=SB Nation|accessdate=August 10, 2017}} During the match, he played in the center-back position instead of his natural position.{{cite news|title=Everton loanee Antonee Robinson out to teach Bolton Wanderers a few new tricks|url=http://www.theboltonnews.co.uk/sport/15460535.Everton_loanee_Robinson_out_to_teach_Wanderers_a_few_new_tricks/|publisher=The Bolton News|date=August 9, 2017|accessdate=February 14, 2018}} He has also been called into the USA under-20 side.{{cite web|url=http://www.hitc.com/en-gb/2017/03/29/report-everton-take-jurgen-klinsmanns-son-jonathan-on-trial/|title=Report: Everton take Jurgen Klinsmann's son, Jonathan, on trial as Antonee Robinson attracts interest|publisher=HITC|accessdate=August 10, 2017}} On May 28, 2018 he made his full [[USMNT]] debut playing the full 90 minutes vs Bolivia.{{cite web|url=http://www.espn.com/soccer/club/united-states/660/blog/post/3511977/antonee-robinson-excels-in-us-debut-as-americans-breeze-past-bolivia|title=Antonee Robinson excels in U.S. debut as Americans breeze past Bolivia|publisher=ESPN|accessdate=May 29, 2018}} ==Career statistics== {{updated|match played November 10, 2018}} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |+ Appearances and goals by club, season and competition |- !rowspan="2"|Club !rowspan="2"|Season !colspan="3"|League !colspan="2"|[[FA Cup]] !colspan="2"|[[EFL Cup|League Cup]] !colspan="2"|Other !colspan="2"|Total |- !Division!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals |- |[[Everton F.C.|Everton]] |[[2015–16 Everton F.C. season|2015–16]]{{Soccerbase season|85572|2015|accessdate=October 5, 2017}} |[[Premier League]] |0||0||0||0||0||0||colspan="2"|—||0||0 |- |[[Everton F.C. Reserves and Academy|Everton U23s]] |[[2016–17 Professional U23 Development League|2016–17]]{{Soccerbase season|85572|2016|accessdate=October 5, 2017}} |[[Professional Development League|Premier League 2, Div 1]] |colspan="2"|—||colspan="2"|—||colspan="2"|—||3Appearances in the [[EFL Trophy]]||0||3||0 |- |[[Bolton Wanderers F.C.|Bolton Wanderers]] (loan) |[[2017–18 Bolton Wanderers F.C. season|2017–18]]{{Soccerbase season|85572|2017|accessdate=October 5, 2017}} |rowspan='2'|[[EFL Championship|Championship]] |30||0||1||0||3||0||0||0||34||0 |- |[[Wigan Athletic F.C.|Wigan Athletic]] (loan) |[[2018–19 Wigan Athletic F.C. season|2018–19]] |15||0||0||0||0||0||0||0||15||0 |- !colspan="3"|Career total !45!!0!!1!!0!!3!!0!!3!!0!!52!!0 |} {{reflist|group=lower-alpha}} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * {{soccerway|antonee-robinson/409164}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Robinson, Antonee}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:1997 births]] [[Category:People from Milton Keynes]] [[Category:Association football fullbacks]] [[Category:American soccer players]] [[Category:United States men's youth international soccer players]] [[Category:English footballers]] [[Category:English people of American descent]] [[Category:Everton F.C. players]] [[Category:Bolton Wanderers F.C. players]] [[Category:English Football League players]] [[Category:United States men's international soccer players]]
